{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3559927,"name":"Jack Ross","username":"Rossj2245","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rossj2245/{size}/231414_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T23:57:59.725Z","cooked":"

Hello,
I was recently on here looking for help with out PathPlanner . For background this is my first year programming the robot and using swerve. I have tried through Buildseason to do my best to Tune PIDS for CTRE using many different things. However with less than 6 days till our first comp we are running out of time. Our swerve is choppy and sometimes will get airborne. I tied looking up videos to watch to see other tuning it but unfortunately I still don’t truly know what to look for and how. I’ll provide a link to my code if it makes any difference. I know some teams are able to get there swerve very smooth and that is our ideal result. I recently was told to use Advantage Kit Template to tune some of my values but I think it only made them worse Any tips or commands to help speed this along would be really helpful. Thank you all.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-17T23:57:59.725Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":47,"readers_count":46,"score":29.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":495978,"topic_slug":"ctre-swerve-tuner-issues","display_username":"Jack Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/MCRobotics7045/Robot-Source-Code-2025-Reefscape","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - MCRobotics7045/Robot-Source-Code-2025-Reefscape: code code and some PIDs here and there","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67491,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/ctre-swerve-tuner-issues/495978/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3560832,"name":"Matthew Flanegan","username":"TheCrackerSnacker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thecrackersnacker/{size}/255683_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T17:53:56.222Z","cooked":"

Here is my advice for manual tuning.

  1. Set P, I and D to 0.
  2. Increase P until you get oscillations
  3. Set P to about 60% of the value that caused oscillations (a little more if you’re feeling dangerous)
  4. Throw a small amount of D in the mix. Keep increasing until weird stuff starts happening and then back off.
  5. If you were able to add any D, increase the P a smidge.
  6. Avoid integral unless you get steady state error. If you have to add any beware of the extra oscillations it will cause. You may have to back off on the P a little bit.
  7. Try this advice, and ignore it if it doesn’t work.

I should only be really tuning my Turn Motors Correct? Not my drive motors. If so how do i even find the correct values for Drive. Also is it normal for when I give the motors to turn they aren’t a smooth motion. It snaps to position and rapidly adjusts for the Xbox Controller.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-18T18:07:00.430Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":18,"readers_count":17,"score":8.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":495978,"topic_slug":"ctre-swerve-tuner-issues","display_username":"Jack Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":74436,"username":"TheCrackerSnacker","name":"Matthew Flanegan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thecrackersnacker/{size}/255683_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67491,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/ctre-swerve-tuner-issues/495978/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3560875,"name":"Matthew Flanegan","username":"TheCrackerSnacker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thecrackersnacker/{size}/255683_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T18:29:07.950Z","cooked":"
Rossj2245:

It snaps to position and rapidly adjusts for the Xbox Controller.

If you mean that it moves back and forth a lot, you should probably turn down P. As to the correct values for drive, I believe setting P to 1 and calling it a day may be sufficient. If that doesn’t work, then I don’t know what to do for the drive PID. My advice was more for general PID tuning; I have experience YAGSL but not CTRE Swerve.
